children.text: There are holes drilled through the joinery without cover plates installed.
The Victorian Building Authority’s Guide to Standards and Tolerances clause 7.08 Pipe penetrations through external walls and inside cupboards states that

‘Plumbing holes are defective if they are not fitted through neat minimal size penetrations (in the case of cabinetwork), or fitted with tight fitting cover plates or collars with penetrations kept to the smallest size practicable’.
The joinery holes in this area should be replaced with cover plates in accordance with above.
